title: KaTeX rendering after markdown parser.
body:
**Describe the bug**

KaTeX rendering after markdown parser. Parts of the 
````
$$
\begin{equation}
    \begin{aligned}
        L                   &= \text{dim}(\bm{x})                                              && \bm{x}\in{\mathbb{R}}^{L} \\
        \mathcal{X}_0       &= \bm{x}_i^-                                                      && k=1,...,L                 \\
        \mathcal{X}_k       &= \bm{x}_i^- + \bigg(\sqrt{(L+\lambda)\bm{P}_i^-}\bigg)_k         && k=1,...,L                 \\
        \mathcal{X}_k       &= \bm{x}_i^- + \bigg(\sqrt{(L+\lambda)\bm{P}_i^-}\bigg) _{k-L}    && k=L+1,...,2L              \\
        W_0^{(m)}           &= \lambda(L-\lambda)                                                                           \\
        W_0^{(m)}           &= \lambda(L-\lambda) + (1-\alpha^2 + \beta)                                                    \\
        W_k^{(m)}           &= W_k^{(c)} = 1/\{2(L+\lambda)\}                                  && k=1,...,2L                \\
    \end{aligned}
\end{equation}
$$

````

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: [e.g. iPhone6]
 - OS: [e.g. iOS]
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]

**Additional context**
- [Relevant issue](https://discourse.gohugo.io/t/is-there-any-way-to-ignore-underscore-when-rendering-markdown/5801/6)

title: Implement `conda` package of `multidoc` into workflow
body:
Copy pasted from slack:

> Also [@Dominic Dirkx](https://tudat.slack.com/team/UU5T8GRU2), [@Filippo](https://tudat.slack.com/team/U01GSTLKSVA) [@Jonas Hener](https://tudat.slack.com/team/U01PHJ0MTK8) [@Jeremie G](https://tudat.slack.com/team/U02EFR3H524), whoever is building documentation, would anyone have a moment during a docs build to use (and verify) [this conda package for multidoc ](https://anaconda.org/ggarrett13/multidoc)in place of our copy pasted source code for multidoc (for the tudatpy docs) I managed to publish the package yesterday and setup the pipeline, which will make any modifications to multidoc a lot easier to integrate now. If no one is sure what I'm referring to, then perhaps my questionable janky solution for tudatpy docs has gone under the radar luckily

title: Request: change of style for enumeration
body:
It bugs me a little that, for the API docs of enumerations, the entire text appears to be inside quotation blocks.
For instance, in the picture below, it seems to me that the text beside the green lines should be out of the lighter box, at the same "level" as the "members:" text.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50528981/155235799-b268afb5-d4b8-43bb-8c8a-9c642192e855.png)
I do not know if there is a reason for this or if this is caused by a mistake in how we write the docstrings.
If this is unintentional, I don't know if you @geoffreygarrett can think of a fix for this?

title: Revise "about" page

repository.name: tudat-space
repository.description: An introduction and guide to tudat-space.

body:
This is a follow-up from #21 and it concerns this [page](https://tudat-space.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_src_about/about.html).

The page should be split in 4 different subpages (in parenthesis, you see who I think are the most suitable people to draft these pages - what I need is content, even in the form of word documents, while I can fix the style itself if needed):

- [ ] history of the project (@DominicDirkx)
- [ ] roadmap + ongoing activities (@DominicDirkx @geoffreygarrett)
- [ ] success stories (@DominicDirkx - presenting in more detail a selection of the current list of papers + the full list as it is should suffice)
- [ ] core team + past contributors (@FilippoOggionni)

title: Very large `.git` history due to old resources from legacy

repository.name: tudat
repository.description: A C++ platform to perform astrodynamics and space research.

body:
Perhaps not noticeable in Europe, definitely noticeable in South Africa where I am now, there's a hefty unnecessary ~400 MB in `.git` history. 

[Here's a solution which we can use.](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2100907/how-to-remove-delete-a-large-file-from-commit-history-in-the-git-repository)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26066340/154472061-da55b955-6d1c-4ebc-b82f-9cb87d081792.png)

title: Understand and fix rever ("news" workflow)

repository.name: tudatpy
repository.description: A Python platform to perform astrodynamics and space research.

body:
# Background

@ggarrett13 originally set up the `rever` tool for both tudat and tudatpy. [Rever](https://regro.github.io/rever-docs/news.html) is a tool to manage release versioning, based on the news workflow where each contributor maintains a changelog. An (unfinished) [page](https://tudat-developer.readthedocs.io/en/latest/primer/devops/release_versioning.html#release-versioning) on the tudat developer docs gives info and reference about this.

# Latest updates
The news workflow has not been used by contributors until now. Following the last developer meeting, it was decided to start releasing versions of tudat and tudatpy in a sound manner. The `rever` tool could greatly help in this direction.

# What has been done
I have tried using `rever` both on tudat and tudatpy, but after some debugging the tool still outputs errors. It seems that a [version](https://github.com/tudat-team/tudatpy/releases/tag/0.6.0) was released through `rever`.

# Issues

1. The tool produces errors that I have not been able to solve
2. In general, despite the documentation, I have not been able to fully understand the functioning of `rever` and the news workflow

For both points, some help from @ggarrett13 would be greatly appreciated. 

# Note 1
If the issues are too difficult to be solved, we can also decide to release software versions manually (i.e., via Github and git tags), as I see no problem with that. However, if we manage to understand `rever` and get it to work, the project would be improved as keeping track of the software development over time (through the rever-generated changelog) would be easier. 

# Note 2
Until a decision is not made on this, no changelog nor guidelines on what to do when developing software will be released (see minutes on Slack from last tudat developer meeting).

title: Multiline tagging for parser
body:
Currently, the following have to be added at the end of lines in the docstrings of tudat-multidoc:
- `# [py]` if the line is only for tudatpy.
- `# [cpp]` if the line is only for tudat.

This makes setting up examples particularly cumbersome, as these have to be added at each line of the examples in the docstrings, making their source messier (see [here](https://github.com/tudat-team/tudat-multidoc/blob/25bb9b780b2f3253649a89cdf2e068dbf99265cb/docstrings/numerical_simulation/environment_setup/aerodynamic_coefficients.yaml#L131-L153) as an example).

@FilippoOggionni and I discussed the possibility of having a different type of keyword that could then englobe multiple lines. For instance, how about having `/* [py]` and `[py] */` respectively open and close a set of lines that are to be parsed as if they all ended in `# [py]`?

title: Intersphinx linking to properties not working

repository.name: tudat-space
repository.description: An introduction and guide to tudat-space.

body:
As discussed in the first couple of posts in #25:
https://github.com/tudat-team/tudat-space/issues/25#issuecomment-961882837
we currently have no way of using intersphinx to use links to the tudatpy API docs for class properties. This should be resolved to allow full linking between tudat-space and API docs. Since properties are usually mentioned in the context of the linked class that they belong to, this issue does not have high priority

title: Move content from tudat-space to tudat-developer-docs

repository.name: tudat-developer-docs
repository.description: TU Delft Astrodynamics Toolkit Developer Documentation

body:
The content of [this directory](https://github.com/tudat-team/tudat-space/tree/master/docs/source/outdated/_src_developer) (developer tools) should be moved to the developer docs.

To summarize for simplicity, the main topics of these guides are:

- CMake
- Advanced conda usage
- Developing with CLion
- Conda-smithy
- Advanced github
- Developer environment (e.g., tudat-bundle)

We should check if these information are already present in the developer docs; in that case, they can be merged or removed altogether. I am quite sure that for the developer environment there are some info on the tudat-developer docs, but also in [this](https://github.com/tudat-team/tudat-bundle/blob/main/README.md) README (perhaps it should be updated).

For the remaining bullet points,@ggarrett13, I think you have the best overview of the tudat-developer website, what should go in there and what is already in there. If you can have a look and let me know which rst files of the directory linked above should be kept/merged/ and where you would like them to be, I can take care of moving them and adapting the content.
